definition: a sculptured representation of the upper part of the human figure including the head and neck and usually part of the shoulders and breast
examples: has a bust of Abraham Lincoln in his office

definition: the upper part of the human torso between neck and waist, the breasts of a woman
to break or smash especially with force, to make inoperative
to bring an end to : break up
examples: better not try to bust up his happy marriage
the game of cheaters, which has busted more men than blackjack

definition: to tease or give a hard time to

examples: busted them to the bottom of the seniority list
felt like busting him in the face

definition: to execute or perform (a difficult, elaborate, or acrobatic movement, as when dancing)
examples: Hot Hot Heat's jittery, caffeinated rhythms and disco grooves are helping persuade punk kids to bust a move …

definition: to lose at cards by exceeding a limit (such as the count of 21 in blackjack)
to fail to complete a straight (see straight entry 4 sense 3) or flush

examples: a good bust on the nose

definition: a police raid (see raid entry 1 sense 2b)

examples: made a couple of drug busts
